intro: Astragalus olchonensis, commonly known as the Mongolian milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the steppes of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Astragalus olchonensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife in its native habitat.
